title: Turkey launches airstrikes against Kurdish militants in Iraq and Syria following 'terror attack' on Turkish aerospace firm
content: After an attack on Turkey's aviation company TUSAS, the Turkish air force struck Kurdish militant targets in Iraq and Syria, killing five people and destroying over 30 targets. An ongoing hostage situation was reported, coinciding with a major trade fair in Istanbul. Responsibility remains unclaimed.
summary: After an attack on Turkey's aviation company TUSAS, the Turkish air force struck Kurdish militant targets in Iraq and Syria, killing five people and destroying over 30 targets. An ongoing hostage situation was reported, coinciding with a major trade fair in Istanbul. Responsibility remains unclaimed.

title: Kamala denies that sexism is a factor in US presidential race, despite polls suggesting otherwise
content: Vice President Kamala Harris asserts that America is ready for a woman and a woman of color to be president, emphasizing that her focus is on addressing the concerns of the American people rather than on her gender or racial background. Harris downplays the suggestion that sexism impacts the presidential race.
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris asserts that America is ready for a woman and a woman of color to be president, emphasizing that her focus is on addressing the concerns of the American people rather than on her gender or racial background. Harris downplays the suggestion that sexism impacts the presidential race.

title: James Carville says he's certain Kamala Harris will win, gives 3 reasons
content: ​James Carville said he is certain that Kamala Harris will win the election. Explaining his argument, Carville wrote that in 2020 Trump was decisively bucked from the White House. Democrats, on the other hand, have been performing well in special elections since Trump appointees on the Supreme Court helped take away a basic right of American women, he wrote. "Guess what? Abortion is on the ballot again — for president."
summary: ​James Carville said he is certain that Kamala Harris will win the election. Explaining his argument, Carville wrote that in 2020 Trump was decisively bucked from the White House. Democrats, on the other hand, have been performing well in special elections since Trump appointees on the Supreme Court helped take away a basic right of American women, he wrote. "Guess what? Abortion is on the ballot again — for president."

title: Deeply troubling that Donald Trump would invoke Hitler: Harris speaks out on John Kelly's claim
content: “It is deeply troubling and incredibly dangerous that Donald Trump would invoke Adolf Hitler, the man who is responsible for the deaths of 6 million Jews and hundreds of thousands of Americans,” Harris said Wednesday just now outside her official residence at the Naval Observatory in northwest Washington DC. “All of this is further evidence for the American people of who Donald Trump really is,” she claimed.
summary: “It is deeply troubling and incredibly dangerous that Donald Trump would invoke Adolf Hitler, the man who is responsible for the deaths of 6 million Jews and hundreds of thousands of Americans,” Harris said Wednesday just now outside her official residence at the Naval Observatory in northwest Washington DC. “All of this is further evidence for the American people of who Donald Trump really is,” she claimed.

title: US presidential election slipping away from Kamala Harris? What Democrats think
content: Democratic concerns are mounting as Vice President Harris appears to be losing footing against former President Trump in critical battleground states. Polls in Michigan, Pennsylvania, and Wisconsin, among others, indicate a shift towards Trump, alarming strategists. However, Harris's vigorous campaign efforts and upcoming key appearances keep some Democrats hopeful for a turnaround.
summary: Democratic concerns are mounting as Vice President Harris appears to be losing footing against former President Trump in critical battleground states. Polls in Michigan, Pennsylvania, and Wisconsin, among others, indicate a shift towards Trump, alarming strategists. However, Harris's vigorous campaign efforts and upcoming key appearances keep some Democrats hopeful for a turnaround.

title: McDonald’s E. Coli outbreak: List of states affected, latest updates
content: McDonald’s E. Coli outbreak: ​There are many kinds of harmless E. coli, but a few types can make people seriously ill. The McDonald's outbreak is caused by E. coli O157:H7, which produces a toxin that causes dangerous diarrhea and can lead to kidney failure and other serious problems, according to the CDC.
summary: McDonald’s E. Coli outbreak: ​There are many kinds of harmless E. coli, but a few types can make people seriously ill. The McDonald's outbreak is caused by E. coli O157:H7, which produces a toxin that causes dangerous diarrhea and can lead to kidney failure and other serious problems, according to the CDC.

title: 'Prince Harry a 'slaughter lamb' in Meghan Markle's wrong scheme of things'
content: Royal author Tina Brown said Meghan Markle is flawless at getting everything wrong. She had the worst judgement and though she has people whom she asks for advice, she does not listen to those and does what she thinks right and that is inevitably always wrong. The author said Meghan has run out of road but Harry will always remain Harry and he's best at being that.
summary: Royal author Tina Brown said Meghan Markle is flawless at getting everything wrong. title: Personal trainer accuses 'Diddy' of drugging and passing him ‘around like a party favor’ to A-listers
Nate Silver's gut says Donald Trump is winning: 'But don't trust anyone's gut'
content: "So OK, I'll tell you. My gut says Donald Trump. And my guess is that it is tru for many anxious Democrats," Nate wrote. "But I don’t think you should put any value whatsoever on anyone’s gut — including mine. Instead, you should resign yourself to the fact that a 50-50 forecast really does mean 50-50. And you should be open to the possibility that those forecasts are wrong, and that could be the case equally in the direction of Mr. Trump or Ms. Harris."
summary: "So OK, I'll tell you. My gut says Donald Trump. And my guess is that it is tru for many anxious Democrats," Nate wrote. "But I don’t think you should put any value whatsoever on anyone’s gut — including mine. Instead, you should resign yourself to the fact that a 50-50 forecast really does mean 50-50. And you should be open to the possibility that those forecasts are wrong, and that could be the case equally in the direction of Mr. Trump or Ms. Harris."

title: Yelp disables reviews of McDonald’s where Trump served fries. Here's why

title: Vivek Ramaswamy hits out at Eminem's 'retribution' attack: 'It wasn't Trump'
content: Sharing the clip, Republican leader and former GOP preidcent hopeful Vivek Ramaswamy hit back at Eminen and said there's only one presidnet in the US history who is pursuing legal retribution against the opposition candidate and that's not Trump. Referring to the lawsuits against Trump and blamind the Biden-Harris administration for that, Vivek posted: "There’s only one President in U.S. history that has pursued legal retribution against the opposition candidate in the middle of an election. Hint: it wasn’t Trump."
summary: Sharing the clip, Republican leader and former GOP preidcent hopeful Vivek Ramaswamy hit back at Eminen and said there's only one presidnet in the US history who is pursuing legal retribution against the opposition candidate and that's not Trump. title: First AI death? Character.ai faces lawsuit after Florida teen's suicide. He was speaking to Daenerys Targaryen
content: 14-year-old Sewell Setzer III knew that Daenerys Targaryen, a chatbot based on a character of Game of Thrones, was not a real person but he developed an emotional attachment and used to text the bot constantly. On his last day of his life too, he messaged Dany: "I miss you, baby sister." “I miss you too, sweet brother,” the chatbot replied.
summary: 14-year-old Sewell Setzer III knew that Daenerys Targaryen, a chatbot based on a character of Game of Thrones, was not a real person but he developed an emotional attachment and used to text the bot constantly. On his last day of his life too, he messaged Dany: "I miss you, baby sister." “I miss you too, sweet brother,” the chatbot replied.

title: 'Hitler-admirer', 'dictionary-definition fascist': Why John Kelly turned on Trump
content: John Kelly, Donald Trump's ex-chief of staff, accused Trump of being a fascist, citing admiration for dictators like Hitler and a disregard for the rule of law. Kelly's comments come amid the tight election race between Trump and Kamala Harris. ​“Well, looking at the definition of fascism: It’s a far-right authoritarian, ultranationalist political ideology and movement characterized by a dictatorial leader, centralized autocracy, militarism, forcible suppression of opposition, belief in a natural social hierarchy,” Kelly said.
summary: John Kelly, Donald Trump's ex-chief of staff, accused Trump of being a fascist, citing admiration for dictators like Hitler and a disregard for the rule of law. Kelly's comments come amid the tight election race between Trump and Kamala Harris. ​“Well, looking at the definition of fascism: It’s a far-right authoritarian, ultranationalist political ideology and movement characterized by a dictatorial leader, centralized autocracy, militarism, forcible suppression of opposition, belief in a natural social hierarchy,” Kelly said.

title: American Airlines fined $50 million for mishandling wheelchairs, injuring passengers
content: American Airlines faces a $50 million fine for failing to properly assist disabled passengers and mishandling over 10,760 wheelchairs from 2019 to 2023. The DOT investigation revealed systemic neglect and injury incidents, prompting unprecedented penalties. Despite recent improvements and compensations, advocacy groups call for more robust measures to protect disabled travelers.
summary: American Airlines faces a $50 million fine for failing to properly assist disabled passengers and mishandling over 10,760 wheelchairs from 2019 to 2023. The DOT investigation revealed systemic neglect and injury incidents, prompting unprecedented penalties. Despite recent improvements and compensations, advocacy groups call for more robust measures to protect disabled travelers.

title: Elon Musk's ex Grimes says she became 'way less gay' after...
content: Grimes and Elon Musk share three children: four-year-old son X Æ A-12 Musk; three-year-old daughter Exa Dark Sideræl; and son Techno Mechanicus, whose exact age is not known. Grimes made an intriguing X post as she said she became "way less gay" after she became pregnant. "I became way less gay after I was pregnant, my ability to focus on reading and writing went way up, as did my general creativity, but my ability to focus on technical things went *way* down. Is this all explained by hormones?" she wanted to know from X.
summary: Grimes and Elon Musk share three children: four-year-old son X Æ A-12 Musk; three-year-old daughter Exa Dark Sideræl; and son Techno Mechanicus, whose exact age is not known.  Grimes made an intriguing X post as she said she became "way less gay" after she became pregnant. title: 'Trump will win if early voting trends hold, and that's a big if...'
content: Analyst Mark Halperin said early voting numbers need to be tracked "day to day" and these figures are "more important than the polls right now" because "it's giving us insight into a variety of factors that are counting for a Republican overperformance by various metrics in the early voting in the battleground states". But one downside of relying too much on these early voting numbers is that it's not know who they are voting. "It can change. We don't know exactly who's casting these ballots, how they are voting etc," Halperin said.
summary: Analyst Mark Halperin said early voting numbers need to be tracked "day to day" and these figures are "more important than the polls right now" because "it's giving us insight into a variety of factors that are counting for a Republican overperformance by various metrics in the early voting in the battleground states". But one downside of relying too much on these early voting numbers is that it's not know who they are voting. "It can change. We don't know exactly who's casting these ballots, how they are voting etc," Halperin said.

title: Watch: Israeli missile destroys Beirut building in seconds – Dramatic footage caught on camera
content: Israeli forces conducted a missile strike on a Beirut apartment building, captured in real-time by an AP photographer. Despite prior warnings leading to evacuation and no casualties, the attack highlights the ongoing offensive targeting Hezbollah strongholds and financial resources in Lebanon, escalating regional tensions.
summary: Israeli forces conducted a missile strike on a Beirut apartment building, captured in real-time by an AP photographer. Despite prior warnings leading to evacuation and no casualties, the attack highlights the ongoing offensive targeting Hezbollah strongholds and financial resources in Lebanon, escalating regional tensions.

title: Lawmakers: South Korea's spy chief says North Korea has sent another 1,500 troops to Russia
content: South Korea's spy agency reports that North Korea has sent a total of 3,000 special operation forces to Russia to aid in its war against Ukraine, with plans to deploy 10,000 troops by December. Strengthened military cooperation between North Korea and Russia raises concerns about potential advancements in North Korea's nuclear and missile capabilities, particularly for South Korea.
summary: South Korea's spy agency reports that North Korea has sent a total of 3,000 special operation forces to Russia to aid in its war against Ukraine, with plans to deploy 10,000 troops by December. Strengthened military cooperation between North Korea and Russia raises concerns about potential advancements in North Korea's nuclear and missile capabilities, particularly for South Korea.

title: Japan introduces blade-proof umbrellas on trains to enhance passenger safety
content: To bolster passenger safety, 1,200 blade-resistant umbrellas will be placed on 600 trains in Japan's Kansai region. Introduced by JR West after recent knife attacks, these lightweight umbrellas have reinforced components to act as shields. They are practical for use in emergencies, offering protection and allowing passengers to evacuate safely.
summary: To bolster passenger safety, 1,200 blade-resistant umbrellas will be placed on 600 trains in Japan's Kansai region. Introduced by JR West after recent knife attacks, these lightweight umbrellas have reinforced components to act as shields. They are practical for use in emergencies, offering protection and allowing passengers to evacuate safely.
